speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk, Scott Maisano  WRITERS GUILD OF AMERICA

speaker: Episodic Comedy (TV)
text: Joe Keenan, Christopher Lloyd  ## Nominated  EMMY
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, Andre Caporaso, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Joe Keenan, Christopher Lloyd  * * *  ## Transcript {david langley}    _ACT ONE  Scene One -- Hallway Outside Frasier's Apartment FADE IN: Roz is standing at the door to Frasier's apartment when the elevator opens and Frasier, Daphne, Niles and Mel get off.  All four are dressed in black. _
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Roz.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, there you are.  I brought something for Daphne and I was just gonna leave it with the doorman. [_Daphne begins to cry_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord. _Reset to: Living Room They go in.  Daphne heads into the powder room._

speaker: Roz
text: Did I say something?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually our doorman, Morrie, passed away this week. We just got back from the funeral.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my gosh, I'm so sorry.  Is she going to be all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, she's been a little high-strung all week, even before he died.  I guess it's just wedding stuff, you know.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, sorry 'bout that.  So, you brought me something, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, yeah.  I figured you couldn't get married without wearing something borrowed. [_Hands her a small box_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  What a beautiful garter!  Look at all the lovely detail.

speaker: Niles
text: I especially like the little odometer.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you so much, Roz.

speaker: Mel
text: Does anybody besides me feel like a cup of coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'll brew a pot.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, don't be silly. I've been here enough times to know how to get the coffee made.  Daphne, make us some coffee. [_Then_] Kidding!

speaker: Roz
text: [_picking up a folder_] The Wayside Inn.  This is where you're having your wedding?  Oh gosh, it's just so beautiful.

speaker: Daphne
text: I hope it is, the planning's been a nightmare.  I spent an hour today on the seating charts.  Everyone has some demand. "Don't sit me near the band", "Do you mind if I bring a friend?"...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, you can't seat me next to him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Exactly!  Every selfish, whiny little thing...

speaker: Roz
text: No, you cannot seat me next to Tim Walsh.  I dated him all last summer and he dumped me.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's going with my bridesmaid Annie.  I have to seat the bridesmaids together.

speaker: Roz
text: This always happens to me.  Is there no place I can go without running into some guy I've dated?

speaker: Niles
text: I was reading about a Trappist monastery in the Amazon that they somehow built into the treetop.

speaker: Roz
text: Shut up, ya big doily!  This is gonna be awful!  Here I am at a wedding, sitting next to a guy who dumped me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on Roz, you won't be alone.  You'll be on the arm of a well-known Seattle boulevardier and radio star.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I can't go with you.  I mean, going to a wedding with your boss is like going to the prom with your brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles and I did not go to the prom together!  Our dates were sick and we went stag!

speaker: Niles
text: In retrospect, yes, we should have canceled the horse-drawn carriage, but hindsight is 20/20. **MEMENTO MORRIE** _Scene Two - Frasier's Living Room FADE IN: Martin enters carrying a gift bag._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Martin.  I'm really sorry to hear about your friend Morrie.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.  Yeah, his wife just did the nicest thing. I guess she knew Eddie and I'd stop by and shoot the breeze with him, so she gave us something to remember him by.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well. [_Reading the tag_] "For Martin and Eddie." Gee, isn't that nice?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I think it's some kinda wine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes I'd say so, but...

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, Dad!  This is a 1945 Chateau Petrus!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah?  She said he got it from his uncle who was in France after the war.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's one of the rarest bottles in the world!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you're good, maybe Eddie'll give you a glass out of his half.

speaker: Niles
text: I've never even seen a '45 Petrus!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, poor Morrie.  He probably waited his whole life for an occasion special enough to open that bottle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Perhaps this should be a lesson for us all.  Morrie might be standing guard at the door to heaven right now, but he's buzzing us with one last message: Live life now. I'm reminded of a parable...

speaker: Daphne/Niles/Roz
text: Come in! _The door opens and Simon (Daphne's obnoxious brother) enters with a duffel bag._

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon!

speaker: Simon
text: Hello, sis.

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought you were in California.

speaker: Simon
text: Yeah, well, those friends I went to surprise were out of town. So I decided to housesit for 'em, which was lovely.  'Til they came home last night.  I don't know what all the screaming was about, I was the one in the tub!   Where should I put this bag?

speaker: Frasier
text: By the door so you don't forget it when you leave.

speaker: Simon
text: Right.  I think I know everyone here. [_spots Roz_] Or do I? And what would your name be then, Miss?

speaker: Roz
text: Simon, you low-life idiot!  You made a date with me last week and you stood me up!

speaker: Simon
text: Sorry, love, I need a bit more to go on.

speaker: Roz
text: Maybe this'll refresh your memory.

speaker: Simon
text: Roz!  Of course!

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering from kitchen_] Well, look who's back!

speaker: Simon
text: Well, who's this then?  I'd say it was Marty Crane, but he's a bit too young and trim, eh?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, go on! Can I offer you a beer?

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, I hate to drink alone, could I have a sandwich with that?

speaker: Frasier
text: If that beer-swilling boomerang thinks he's staying here, he's got another thing coming.

speaker: Niles
text: Better get a move on, he's already got your address on his duffel bag. _The phone rings, Daphne gets it and goes to her room.  Mel enters from the kitchen with a cup of coffee._

speaker: Mel
text: We'd better get going if we're going to reach the cabin by dark.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cabin?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Mel and I are celebrating our six-month anniversary by taking a little mid-week getaway to her friend's country place.

speaker: Mel
text: Yes, no phones, no stress, just two days of rest and relaxation.  I do have to pick up a little anniversary gift, though, so give me nine minutes and pick me up at the northwest corner of Pike and Elm at 4:42.

speaker: Mel
text: Coming up on 4:33...

speaker: Niles
text: Synchronizing...

speaker: Mel
text: Now! [_Then_] Good, I'm relaxing already.

speaker: Simon
text: Thank you Marty, it's most hospitable of you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you gotta have a place to stay...

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop right there!  He cannot stay here!  The man is loud, ill-mannered, and the last time he stayed here he killed a ficus tree on the downstairs neighbor's balcony by means which are best left to the imagination!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, I invited Simon to stay in my Winnebago!  Come on Simon, I'll show you your new digs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.  Simon, you know I...

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, no, forget about it.  It's no worse than what I was just sayin' about you in the kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] Good one.

speaker: Simon
text: [_sotto to Martin_] He thinks I'm joking.

speaker: Niles
text: Join me in a sherry, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I think I will, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I have to admit, I'm a little bit nervous about this trip.  I have a feeling Mel may make another push for us to live together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my.

speaker: Niles
text: She's been bringing it up quite a bit lately.  She says it's a good way for us to test our relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're afraid you'll discover things about each other that you won't like?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.  No, no.  We're past that stage.  She knows my likes and dislikes. I've come attuned to her various quirks... eccentricities... bugaboos.... b�te noirs... night terrors.  It's the fun of being in love.  I don't know what's bothering me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it possible that your foot-dragging might have anything to do with some lingering feelings for Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, uh, you must realize I put that behind me months ago.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just asking.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm very happy with Mel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well then, what's your problem?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, well, let's see.   I just got through with a rough divorce.  I do have a tendency to be overly cautious...

speaker: Frasier
text: This could be a chance to change all that.

speaker: Niles
text: So you're in favor of it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've never really been the president of the Mel fan club, but she does seem to make you happy.  And as we were reminded this morning, life is not to be taken in baby steps. Ask not for whom the doorman buzzes...

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  All right.  That was much-needed therapy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was my pleasure.  You're my brother, you get the family rate.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.  Got all the way down to the Winnebago and realized I had the wrong keys.

speaker: Niles
text: See you guys in a couple of days.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't say, mum.  Your phlebitis again?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_bellowing_] Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Got to go now, mum, Dr. Crane's on the warpath again.  Bye. [_Hangs up, then to Frasier_] Thank you!

speaker: Martin
text: Daph, I'm glad you're here, because I was thinking about that wine of Morrie's.  You know, that's something really for a special occasion.  So, I'd like you to have for the wedding, enjoy it on your honeymoon.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_starting to cry_] Oh, Mr. Crane!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Daphne, come on.  Come on now, it's only a bottle of wine. I don't even know that much about it.  Frasier?  Help me out here, will you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Dad, Chateau Petrus is a premier crux Bordeaux...

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no.  No, I mean with Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: There you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry to get so emotional like this.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right.  The funeral must've really upset you.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not that.  Dr. Crane?  I've wanted to talk to you about this all week, but I haven't known what to say. You promise you'll keep this just between us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's about your brother.  You see, I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Know what?

speaker: Daphne
text: I know about his feelings for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!  How did you find out?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not important.

speaker: Frasier
text: Somebody blabbed, didn't they?  Why can't people just mind their own business?  Who was the nattering gossip?  Roz? Dad?

speaker: Daphne
text: You.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: You were taking those pills for your back and you blurted it out while I was giving you a massage.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, they were very strong pills, you see...

speaker: Daphne
text: Needless to say, it completely took my breath away.  At first, I tried to forget about it, put it out of my mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the bottle said just to take one, but I'm a big man...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, will you shut up about those pills?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Anyway, after a while, I couldn't put it out of my mind anymore.  I find myself thinking about him all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne... are you saying that you have feelings for Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I do.  Oh, I don't know!  Even if I did, he may not feel that way about me anymore, he's with Mel now!

speaker: Frasier
text: I-I don't know what to tell you, Daph.  Uh, I, I, think the best thing is for you to, to try to find a way to talk with Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ugh.  That's not an easy conversation to have.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's easier now than after you're married.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're right, I have to talk to him.  And right away.  I'm already making myself sick over this.  If I leave it any longer, I'll be a complete basket case.  Uh, did he mention if he was going home?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, ah, actually, um, ah, he's going, ah, somewhere else first.  Um...

speaker: Daphne
text: Where? _CUT TO: the hallway. Martin and Simon are getting off the elevator._

speaker: Martin
text: Get you some towels and you'll be all set down there.

speaker: Simon
text: Right. _They enter the apartment, Daphne is again sobbing on Frasier's shoulder._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, Daphne!  It's just a bottle of wine! _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **ABSENCE MAKES THE HEART GROW FATTER** _Scene One - Frasier's Living Room. The doorbell rings._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_v.o._] I'll get it! _FADE IN: Daphne is in the apartment, eating cookies from a large bag. She puts the bag down, composes herself... and opens the door to reveal Frasier holding a lot of packages._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.  Dr. Crane!  I didn't even know you'd gone out. I thought you might be your brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I went down to get the mail and got all these wedding gifts for you.  But don't worry, Niles called and said he'd be coming by this afternoon.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_picking up the bag and eating another cookie_] I don't even know how I'm going to begin this conversation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure those chocolate-chip blackened teeth'll be a nice icebreaker.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've been so nervous lately, I've done nothing but stuff myself with junk food.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's him!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, fine.  You're gonna be just fine. Okay?  Remember to speak from the heart.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane!

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks!  Eddie started doing his "I don't know how much longer I can hold this" dance and I just ran out without my keys.  Have you ever seen him do that dance?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just the droll impression of it you do at parties, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_again eating cookies_] You know, Mr. Crane, Eddie seems awfully fidgety.  I don't think he got enough exercise on that walk.

speaker: Martin
text: Anybody needs any exercise, it's you, the way you're eating now.  You know, when they put "Party Size" on that cookie bag, they don't mean party of one. _The doorbell rings again.  Frasier takes the bag and Daphne composes herself again -- then opens the door to Simon. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon!  What do you want?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, I've just come to borrow a pen so I can fill out this job application.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Oh, you're applying for work?  Well here, allow me. [_Gives him a pen_] Gosh, we'll miss you around here, but onward and upward! [_laughs_] So, what's the job?

speaker: Simon
text: Doorman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God.

speaker: Simon
text: Well, it's ideal for me, really.  Nice cozy chair, plenty of time to think the long, long thoughts of youth.  Not to mention what the uniforms do for the ladies, ah? [_laughs_] If memory serves, a certain bellhop back in Manchester found that out with a young lady who will remain nameless.

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon! [_to Frasier_] I tell you, I'm this close to just poppin' him one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now Daphne.  Daphne, you just have to calm down.  Here, have a cookie. [_Gives her the bag, she eats one_]

speaker: Simon
text: What is up with your appetite lately?  What, are you knocked up or somethin'?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course not!

speaker: Simon
text: Now, now, you wouldn't be the first person in our family to be walking down the aisle carrying more than just a bouquet. _Daphne lunges at him, with Frasier holding her back. The doorbell rings again._

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Simon, why don't you finish filling that out in the kitchen and help yourself to a beer?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, great! _He goes to the kitchen.  Frasier takes the bag as Daphne composes herself again... and opens the door to-_

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, guys!  Hey, Frasier?  I felt kinda bad about the other day, dumping you as my wedding date...

speaker: Frasier
text: You want me back, don't you?

speaker: Roz
text: And I'm sick about it.  But I can't find anybody else.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry Roz, I already invited somebody else, she's driving up on Saturday to join me.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, get rid of her!  I need a date!  I'm desperate!

speaker: Simon
text: Well, well, somebody here is singin' my favorite song.

speaker: Roz
text: Simon?  There's a guy who lives in the park across the street from me.  He wears a cat suit and meows at people.  If he's busy, maybe I'll call you.

speaker: Simon
text: I'm prettying myself up, just in case.  Speaking of which, Daphne, I borrowed your blow dryer for my job interview.

speaker: Daphne
text: I spent an hour looking for that!  I thought I was losing my mind!

speaker: Simon
text: Well, that does happen to women in your condition.  You know, in the family way.

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering_] You're pregnant?

speaker: Daphne
text: I AM NOT PREGNANT!

speaker: Simon
text: What, just another scare, then?  Like that time back in school with that Pakistani chap?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_lunges at him_] Right, that's it, you pig! _Roz ducks out of the way.  Frasier gets in front of her, scoops her over his shoulder and heads for the door._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, put me down!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne and I are going out for a breath of fresh air, perhaps retrieve her blow dryer.  Oh, if Niles should happen to stop by, keep him here.  There's something important I need to discuss with him. _He is going out into the hall as he says this.  Reset to: Hallway He shuts the door._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, for God's sake, put me down!

speaker: Frasier
text: Not until you promise not to kill your brother. _The elevator opens, he goes in and puts her down.  There is a neighbor with a basket of laundry next to them._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, all right!  It's not as if he doesn't deserve it, telling everyone I'm carrying Donny's baby!  Like I don't have enough to worry about today, waiting for Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, Daphne, you have to calm down.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not easy.  I don't even know how to begin with him. "Would you like steak or salmon at my wedding?  And by the way, I think I might be in love with you."

speaker: Frasier
text: You'll find the words when the time comes, all right? [_Glares at the neighbor_] And don't pretend you're not listening, Mrs. Richman!  Your laundry is not that interesting.  [_N.B. Mrs. Richman is Doris from_ [[5.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_9/perspectives_on_christmas.html "Perspectives On Christmas"), "Perspectives on Christmas."_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on George, I'm desperate here.  I promise you a good time.  I mean a REALLY good time, if you get my drift. [_Pause_] You might have mentioned I was on speaker-phone!

speaker: Simon
text: Listen to what you're doing, Roz.  It's not very dignified, is it?

speaker: Martin
text: Come on Roz, give Simon a chance.

speaker: Roz
text: So he can stand me up again?

speaker: Simon
text: And miss my sister's wedding?  Never!  If you're worried about my appearance, I know where I can get my hands on some very nice Armani suits.

speaker: Martin
text: Or you could just grab one out of Frasier's closet.

speaker: Roz
text: What did you think he was talking about?  All right. But Simon, just remember my ex-boyfriend will be there. If anybody asks, you're an internet millionaire.

speaker: Simon
text: Right.  I'll be the perfect, well-bred, up-market gentleman. Now, I'll walk you to the garage.

speaker: Roz
text: Ah, you don't have to.

speaker: Simon
text: No, it's no bother.  I live there. _They go to the door and open it to find (at last!) Niles. He is wearing a large grin._

speaker: Niles
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Simon!

speaker: Simon
text: Well, by the look of that smile on your face, I'd say somebody got himself a bit last night. [_gestures lewdly with arms_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking shocked and appalled_] I find that remark rude, boorish and IMPOSSIBLE TO DENY! [_Breaks out laughing_]

speaker: Simon
text: Brilliant! _Simon gives Niles a punch in the arm, knocking him back into the hallway.  Roz just looks disgusted as they leave.  Niles comes in._

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, how was your trip?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, fantastic, Dad.  Where's Frasier?  I have some news.

speaker: Martin
text: He'll be back in a bit.  What's up?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, uh, I should wait for Frasier, it was really his idea.  Do you mind?

speaker: Martin
text: I can wait.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, I can't!

speaker: Martin
text: What is it?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm married!

speaker: Martin
text: Married?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Mel and I eloped yesterday. [_Martin is stunned_] Well?

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets up to hug him_] Well... congratulations, son!  That's great.  So, uh, you're happy, right?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, happy?  I'm delirious!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you'd have to be, wouldn't you?  So, you say this was Frasier's idea?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, indirectly, yeah.  Oh, oh, before I forget: it occurred to me, I think we should keep this from Daphne and Donny.  I would hate for them to think we were stealing their thunder.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, three guesses what I did yesterday...

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Martin_] Oh, send Daphne away.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier_] Get rid of your father.

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne, could you go to the drugstore?  I'm all out of liniment and my back's gettin' kinda achy.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, that's because you've been sitting in that chair all day.  I'll tell you what, you know what you could use?  A good walk to the drugstore.  Do you a world of good. I'll go with you. _Frasier grabs Martin's arm and cane and starts dragging him to the door._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, okay, all right.  Niles, why don't you come too?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, we'll all go. [_He starts to follow_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, there's something very important I need to discuss with Dad, Niles.  I'm sure you understand.

speaker: Martin
text: Fras...! _Frasier slams the door behind them.  Niles and Daphne look at each other a moment and then Niles's cell phone goes off._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, excuse me. [_Answers phone_] Hello?  Mel, darling! Oh, just hanging out with Daphne. _CUT TO: the hallway. Frasier and Martin are waiting for the elevator._

speaker: Frasier
text: Honestly Dad, when will you learn to take a hint?

speaker: Martin
text: I can't take a hint?  Couldn't you see that Niles wanted to talk to you? _The elevator opens and they get on.  Mrs. Richman is there, without the basket, apparently going back for another load._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, whatever it is, it can wait.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah!  No big deal, he just got married, that's all!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: He eloped with Mel yesterday.

speaker: Richman
text: Poor Daphne...

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you please keep out of this, Mrs. Richman?  We have got to get back up there. [_Stabs at the buttons_]

speaker: Martin
text: We're going to the basement.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't wait that long! _The doors open on a lower floor.  Frasier runs around the corner to the stairs.  CUT BACK TO: the living room._

speaker: Niles
text: [_on phone_] I'll see you later, darling. [_Hangs up_] Sorry about that.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's all right.

speaker: Niles
text: So, forty-eight hours 'til the big day, you must be pretty excited.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's funny you should mention that. [_Sits on the couch beside him_] You see, Dr. Crane...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_bursts through door_] NILES! _Niles and Daphne stand up in shock; Frasier freezes in the door, wondering if his entrance was precipitous._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!  You're back awfully soon!

speaker: Niles
text: You're all out of breath, is something wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, no, no.  It's just there's something I need to discuss with Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: What, now?  We were just having a chat!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I'm sure it can wait.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually Daphne, I need to talk to Frasier, too.  If you don't mind.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Of course not!  It's not like I have anything important to talk about! _She storms off to her room, grabbing the bag of cookies on her way. Martin comes in behind Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, it's just wedding stuff, I guess.  Speaking of which, I understand you have some, some news?  You're married?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  I guess Dad couldn't contain himself any more than I could.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thought you were just gonna move in together.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, so did I!  But then the strangest thing happened. As we talked about it, we got more and more excited about the idea of being together.  And then I remembered your advice.

speaker: Niles
text: To stop taking baby steps through life.  Before we knew it, we were asking the waitress for a phone book so we could find a justice-of-the-peace.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what can I say, but... congratulations.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you!

speaker: Mel
text: Martin!  Or should I say "Dad"?

speaker: Martin
text: [_nervous_] Yeah, I heard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mel.

speaker: Niles
text: Darling... oh, darling, it occurred to me that perhaps we should keep this quiet from Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Keep what quiet?

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, we can't keep something like this a secret! [_takes Niles's hand_] We got married!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_freezes for a second, then_] Did you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, while we were out of town.  But the last thing we want is to upstage you and Donny, so we are not mentioning this outside this room.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coming to them and taking each of their hands_] Well, I am just so happy for you both.

speaker: Niles
text: We're having champagne.  Would you like to join us?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'd love to.  But I have to get a check down to the caterers, they're closing early today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me drive you over, Daphne.
